summary: Email chain from July 2019 discussing suspicious bond trades by Jeffrey Epstein involving Western Digital debt. The emails question how Epstein avoided a 66% loss by selling bonds in September/October 2017, just months before Western Digital announced it would buy back the same debt in February 2018. The correspondence suggests potential insider connections through Western Digital's CEO and the Wexners.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein purchased Western Digital 7.35% bonds in June 2016 and sold them in September/October 2017 at prices that allowed him to avoid a 66% loss that other bondholders would have suffered.
Western Digital announced in February 2018 that it would buy back the same bonds Epstein had sold, suggesting Epstein may have had non-public information about the upcoming buyback.

Western Digital CEO Stephen Milligan is described as 'extremely involved' at Ohio State University, where Abigail Wexner (wife of Les Wexner) is vice chair of the board of trustees, suggesting potential social connections.

Epstein's foundation filing reportedly showed less than $11,000 in interest income from the bonds, which the email author claims should have been significantly higher given the bond's 7.35% interest rate.
The email chain raises questions about who bought the debt from Epstein, allowing him to profit while the market price was much lower, and why such a transaction occurred.
